oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Snow Story by Mae Axton
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This recording is Mae Axton telling the story about Hank Snow with a gentle guitar playing in the background. The recording is from an unidentified date. Tape is the first of an unidentified number of tapes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Mae Axton
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Mae Axton starting the Hank Snow Story with guitar in the background -- (00:14) Begins with Clarence Eugene Snow's birth in 1919 in Canada -- (00:41) First eight years of Snow's life, includes changing his name to Hank -- (2:18) At age 12, Snow sailed as a cabin boy -- (3:06) Snow's love for music and guitars began -- (4:41) Snow learns the guitar -- (5:42) At 16, Snow completes his duty at sea, tries out different jobs, and starts to plan his future -- (9:28) Snow buys his first guitar -- (10:06) Snow's first public appearance -- (10:53) Snow's first time on the radio at the age of 19 -- (12:41) Snow met his wife, Minnie Blanch at a Halloween party and married her a year later -- (14:51) Snow's first big, paid radio show and taught lessons on the side -- (16:36) Snow creates his first few original songs -- (18:54) Snow starts to perform, and eventually live, in the United States of America -- (22:34) Snow moves back to the United States of America -- (25:55) Snow becomes a member of the Grand Ole Opry gang -- (27:31) Named America's Favorite Folk Singer and Number One Folk Singer -- (29:52) Snow's tour of Korea -- (30:32) Launching of the first National Hillbilly day -- (31:58) Snow's son, Jimmy Roger Snow -- (33:22) Permanent home in Nashville with his wife Min -- (34:41) Snow in present day 1955
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Snow, Hank; Axton, Mae Boren;
